sentence.Network_en: At the shrine of the god there were offerings, libations and incense.
sentence.Network_cn: 神殿里供奉着牺牲、鬯酒和贡香。

sentence.Network_en: Egyptians tend to wash down these libations with black tea.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃及人习惯用红茶解酒.

sentence.Network_en: Free libations, holiday revelers, and course, fireworks abound.
sentence.Network_cn: 免费的酒水, 节日狂欢者, 当然还有礼花燃放.

entry.tran: （古希腊和罗马供奉神的）鬯酒，祭酒，奠酒
entry.def: In ancient Greece and Rome, a libation was an alcoholic drink that was offered to the gods.

example.ex: At the shrine of the god there were offerings, libations and incense.
